greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, row sums = a signed, shifted version of A000587, the Rao Uppuluri-Carpenter numbers.
comment: Right border = A000587, the Rao Uppuluri-Carpenter numbers, with different signs: (1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 2, 9, -9, 50, -267, -413, -2180,...).
Row sums = the same sequence shifted: (1, 0, 1, 1, 2, 9,...).
formula: Let A = the self-inverse triangle, A118433. Shift the triangle down one place placing "1" at (0,0). Lim(n..->inf.) A^n, = a signed version B of the Rao Uppuluri-Carpenter numbers (A000587), as follows: (1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 2, 9, -9, 50, -267, -413, -2180,...). A000587 = (1, -1, 0, 1, 1, -2, -9, -9, 50, 267, 413, -2180,...). Triangle A144185 = (A * (an infinite lower triangular matrix with B as the main diagonal and the rest zeros)). These operations are equivalent to (by rows), taking termwise products of A118433 row terms and B, the signed version of the Rao Uppuluri-Carpenter numbers.
example: First few rows of the triangle =

Example: row 5 = (1, -5, 0, 10, 5, -2) = termwise products of row 5 of the self-inverse triangle A118433: (1, -5, -10, 10, 5, -1) and the first 6 terms of the "B" signed version of A000587 (the rao Uppuluri-Carpenter numbers): (1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 2) = (1*1, -5*1, 0*0, 10*1, 5*1, -5*2).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 13 2008
